Description: Slender redware pottery vase with conical base and lid; decorated with black bands.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt), Carnavaron 'tomb 9' (Birabi). Carter identified this as a 17th dynasty tomb, but these vessels come from the courtyard, which contained a mass of mummies and ceramic vessels, not all of which can have been contemporary with the original burial. See Carnavaron and Carter, Five Years Exploration at Thebes (1912), 34-5, pl.26.
Curator's comments: Published: BMS Bulletin, Summer 1988, No. 58. Reeves and Taylor, Howard Carter: Before Tutankhamun, (BM, 1992), p.93 (ill. right). Carnavaron and Carter, Five Years Exploration at Thebes (1912), pl.26
One of a pair, with EA 50748.
Slender jars with bands of black decor are found in 18th dynasty tombs at Deir el-Medina: Nagel, La céramique du Nouvel Empire à Deir el Médineh (DFIFAO 10), fig.43 [13], fig.44 [4].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1989 Jun-Sep, Swaffham Museum, Wonderful Things! The Howard Carter Exhibition
Acquisition name: Donated by: George Herbert, 5th Earl of Carnarvon
